data.text: My son, hast thou sinned? do so no more,
Flee from sin as from the face of a serpent:
All iniquity is as a two edged sword,
To terrify and do wrong will waste riches:
A prayer out of a poor man’s mouth reacheth to the ears of God,
He that hateth reproof is in the way of sinners:
An eloquent man is known far and near;
He that buildeth his house with other men’s money
The congregation of the wicked is like tow wrapped together:
The way of sinners is made plain with stones,
He that keepeth the law of the Lord getteth the understanding thereof:
He that is not wise will not be taught:
The knowledge of a wise man shall abound like a flood:
The inner parts of a fool are like a broken vessel,
If a skillful man hear a wise word,
The talking of a fool is like a burden in the way:
They inquire at the mouth of the wise man in the congregation,
As a house that is destroyed, so is wisdom to a fool:
Doctrine unto fools is as fetters on the feet,
A fool lifteth up his voice with laughter;
Learning is unto a wise man as an ornament of gold,
A foolish man’s foot is soon in his neighbor’s house:
A fool will peep in at the door into the house:
It is the rudeness of a man to hearken at the door:
The lips of talkers will be telling such things as pertain not unto them:
The heart of fools is in their mouth:
When the ungodly curseth Satan,
A whisperer defileth his own soul,
